DOC.brief_summary: This trial will address the effect of uterine artery ligation during Cesarean section in cases with placenta previa to decrease blood loss.
DOC.brief_title: Uterine Artery Ligation to Decrease Blood Loss With Central Placenta Previa
DOC.detailed_description: This Study will address the effect of uterine artery ligation prior to fetal delivery during Cesarean section in cases with central placenta previa to guard against postpartum hemorrhage and to minimize blood loss.
DOC.criteria: Placenta previa is diagnosed when the lowest placental edge is located within 5 cm of the internal os at ultrasound Symptomatic Placenta previa with at least one episode of bleeding Estimated gestational age within 28 to 40 weeks Maternal age > 18 years Informed consent Social affiliation Premature rupture of membranes Severe bleeding. Abnormal fetal heart rates. Preeclampsia, chorioamnionitis, severe chronic renal disease.
